The slides shown in the videos are prepared as an HTML file. You can flip through the slides here, open them all in a new window/tab, or download them as a PDF if you want to save them for later. To navigate through the HTML slides, use the left and right arrow keys. You can also type `?` while viewing the slides to see a list of other commands you can use.

`r blogdown::shortcode("slide-buttons")`

```{r show-slide-tabs, echo=FALSE, results="asis"}
source(here::here("R", "slide_tabs.R"))

sections <- tibble::tribble(
  ~name, ~slide, ~active, ~youtube,
  "Introduction", "2", TRUE, "https://www.youtube.com/embed/wbooMiXADX8?autoplay=1&enablejsapi=1&modestbranding=1&rel=0&start=46",
  "Agenda", "agenda", FALSE, "https://www.youtube.com/embed/wbooMiXADX8?autoplay=1&enablejsapi=1&modestbranding=1&rel=0&start=22",
  "Organization", "organization", FALSE, "https://www.youtube.com/embed/wbooMiXADX8??autoplay=1&enablejsapi=1&modestbranding=1&rel=0&start=91",
  "Look at results", "look-at-results", FALSE, "https://www.youtube.com/embed/wbooMiXADX8?autoplay=1&enablejsapi=1&modestbranding=1&rel=0&start=75"
)

slide_tabs(sections, "/slides/01-slides.html")
```
